abstract: Shares fell sharply amid fears that early investors eligible to offload their stocks would create a surplus on the market.
snippet: Shares fell sharply amid fears that early investors eligible to offload their stocks would create a surplus on the market.
lead_paragraph: The Facebook slide on Wall Street continued on Friday, as the company’s shares reached new lows a day after early investors became eligible to sell their shares on the market. Shares closed down more than 4 percent, to $19.05, after reaching a low of $19.00 during the day — 50 percent lower than its original offering price of $38 in May.

headline.main: Facebook Shares Hit New Low as a Lockup Period Ends
headline.print_headline: Facebook Shares Hit New Low Amid Fear
